title: AlphaTALKS Wall Street Breakfast, Jan. 30: What Moved Markets This Week
author: Seeking Alpha
dc:creator: Seeking Alpha
description:
All GameStop (NYSE:GME), all the time. The battle between retail traders from Reddit and the hedge fund elite dominated all market conversations during the week. Lost in the shuffle was the busiest earnings period of the quarter. Broader stock market indices quietly turned in a losing week, with the Dow Industrials (DJI), S&P 500 (SP500), and Nasdaq Composite (COMP) each due to drop about 3%. Most of the losses came Friday. Volatility as measured by the VIX gained 44% this week. In light of the news that had everybody talking, the Alpha TALKS panel this week threw the traditional playbook out the window. Instead, the conversation followed an outline of three distinct questions on the GameStop fiasco:

The main outcome and lessons;

The anticipated fallout;

Who will emerge as winners and losers.

About This Podcast Alpha TALKS Wall Street Breakfast is a weekly roundtable covering what moved markets this week (WMMTW), featuring a panel of Seeking Alpha editors. Hosted by Nathaniel E. Baker, Senior Editor, Strategic Contributors, and featuring:

Bradley Olesen, VP News;

Kim Khan, Senior News Editor;

Stephen Alpher, Managing Editor News, co-host of Seeking Alpha's Alpha Trader podcast.

AlphaTALKS videos, featuring highlights of this podcast, publish every Friday by close of trading. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
